Description: Rim fragment of East Greek Fikellura pottery amphora. Surface worn. Gritty micaceous orange-red ware, with darker core; slipped cream. On outside of rim, traces of lotus and bud chain; below, a band. Top of rim and inside glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 208, N22): "Similar scheme (possibly from same vessel?): Fairbanks, Boston Cat. No. 330.5 pl. 36 = R.M. Cook BSA 34 (1933-34) 53, Z12. Cook notes a "similar lip fragment, probably from the same vase is in University College, London". Clearly a Naukratis find. The delicate florals are a feature of the South Ionian forerunners of Fikellura Ware: see Walter Kardyi Samos VI 1 pls. 2-11 passim (there classed as Samian) also Cook op. cit. 75-78 fig. 13. Their use on the rim moulding is rather unusual." We are not aware of any such sherd currently in University College London. The Boston amphora is 86.548.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.060)
